strings.Value: Gifted Master
Gifted masters are a jack of all trades. In the truest sense of the word. They are versatile and can do almost anything.
Gifted masters are a jack of all trades.
Gifted master proficiencies
Gifted masters are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus almost all bladed weapons. They are proficient with light armor, but not with shields.
Gifted master bladed weapons
Gifted masters are familiar with bladed weapons such as rapiers, short swords, long swords, dueling swords, scimitars, falcatas, kukris, and estocs.
Skill Focus
At 4th level, and every 4 levels after, a Gifted Master gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}Skill{/g} Focus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
Gifted masters' talents

When a gifted master gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of new abilities. The gifted master gains a new ability at level 1, level 2, and after every four additional levels. An ability cannot be selected more than once.
Weapon Finesse

At 1st level, a gifted master gains Weapon Finesse as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. In addition, starting at 3rd level, she can select any one type of weapon that can be used with Weapon Finesse (such as rapiers or daggers). Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed. Whenever she makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with the selected weapon, she adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g}. If any effect would prevent the gifted master from adding her Strength modifier to the damage {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}, she does not add her Dexterity modifier. The gifted master can select a second weapon at 7th level and a third at 11th level.

At 3rd level, and every three levels thereafter, the gifted master gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as teamwork feats. The gifted master must meet the prerequisites of the selected bonus feat.
Divine Meister
Divine masters are inquisitors or assassins whose faith has been disappointed. They search for orientation in the world and not infrequently go astray.
Charlatan

The charlatan is a funny fellow who gets through life with a few tricks and a bit of magic. Only very rarely does a charlatan have to take up arms, in most cases he manages to wriggle out of trouble through illusion or persuasion.
Grand Mistress of Witchery
A witch gifted beyond measure, who has devoted herself to deception, cunning and illusions to get through life.
